post: Happy St. Patrick's Day from the Bill of Rights Institute! Did you know several U. S. Presidents have Irish roots? From Teddy Roosevelt to Joe Biden and more, Irish American presidents have shaped U. S. history in profound ways. Today, we celebrate the history of Irish American presidents on American democracy and leadership. Check out our playlist on Irish American presidents now!  https://lnkd.in/eD_dinxK  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #StPatricksDay

Attention all educators, mentors, and community leaders! The  #FloridaMyImpactChallenge, hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute and University of Central Florida Florida Joint Center for Citizenship & Lou Frey Instiute, is now accepting submissions from students aged 13-19 who are actively engaged in service, volunteerism, or entrepreneurship within their communities. This is a fantastic opportunity for young social entrepreneurs to showcase their impactful projects and compete for substantial prizes! Participants stand a chance to win: -$2,000 Florida First Prize -$1,500 Florida Second Prize -$1,000 Florida Third Prize -$500 Florida Fourth Prize -5 $250 Pitch Competition Prizes Submissions are open until March 30, 2025, 11:59 PM. All Florida-based entrants will be invited to present their projects in person at the Civics Fair on April 5, 2025, providing a platform to network and gain recognition for their efforts. Encourage the young changemakers in your network to apply and make a difference! For more details and application guidelines, visit the official website:  https://lnkd.in/e2ZyW-hR  #FloridaMyImpactChallenge  #YouthEntrepreneurs  #CivicEngagement  #BillofRightsInstitute

What does it mean to be a responsible citizen? See how students will showcase how they are making a real difference in their communities at our MyImpact Challenge State Civic Fair at the University of Central Florida April 5th. From service projects to civic leadership, these students exemplify our nations virtues. Are you a Florida-based student who should showcase your service project? Apply by April 1, 2025. Learn more about the fair,  https://lnkd.in/eQdnNdgC.

How can students practice the skills of citizenship right now? MyImpact Challenge gives students a robust understanding of the role of the citizen in civil society by exploring the pillars of citizenship: entrepreneurship, charity, and government. It is developed with multiple implementations in mind, including classrooms, afterschool programs, and social clubs. With original background essays, guided resources, and rubrics, students will write a research report on the impacts of these different efforts, then develop and implement a project that exemplifies everyday citizenship. View the MyImpact Challenge lessons now  https://lnkd.in/eRw-N5YT

Are you planning spring break travel? Now you can give back while you go! Through our partnership with TravelingToGive, every purchase you make will help support BRI. Whether you are traveling somewhere warm or checking out a new city, your trip can help fund civic education programs and resources. Book today to make a difference,  https://lnkd.in/epqqzbzz  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #TravelingtoGive  #SpringBreak

MyImpact Challenge State Civic Fairs are more than just a competitionit's about recognizing student leadership and initiative! MyImpact Challenge is a nationwide civic engagement contest open to students ages 13-19. The contest highlights students actively engaged in service, volunteerism, or entrepreneurship in their communities. Are we coming to your state? - Florida State Fair: April 5, 2025 - Missouri State Fair: April 11, 2025 - Utah State Fair: April 29, 2025 Register now!  https://lnkd.in/eKkSxNzF
Dred Scott v. Sandford | Homework Help (full video,  https://lnkd.in/ehKsVwA8) Dred Scott v. Sandford: A Landmark Supreme Court Case  #apush  #ushistory

This  #CivicLearningWeek the Bill of Rights Institute is encouraging students to turn civic knowledge into action. I think [MyImpact Challenge] honestly gave me a lot more appreciation for just how much founding principles and civic virtues of the U. S. are really ingrained in my own values and beliefs  - Caroline Gao 2023 MyImpact Challenge Grand Prize Winner. Carolines civic service based project, The World in Us, landed her the grand prize. The project promoted cross-cultural education by introducing children from across different cultures to each other. Have or know someone who has a project like Carolines? Theres still time to enter a civic based service project for our national civic engagement contest. Start your application today.  https://lnkd.in/eBhJfv2B

This  #CivicLearningWeek the Bill of Rights Institute is encouraging students to turn civic knowledge into action. MyImpact Challenge 2023 First Prize Winner Rylee Kamahele created The Catalyst's Club as a non-profit umbrella for various charitable causes. Learn more about her project and other 2023 winners, here  https://lnkd.in/ex4trSst Have or know someone who has a project like Rylee's? Theres still time to enter a civic based service project for our national civic engagement contest. Start your application today.  https://lnkd.in/eBhJfv2B Well be highlighting student projects all week. Check back in tomorrow to see how students have been making a difference in their community.

What does it mean to exhibit the Founding Principles? The story of America involves figures from diverse backgrounds and differing viewpoints. Using in-depth narratives and primary sources, American Portraits allows students to delve into the lives and backgrounds of some of our most notable figures and analyze their decisions in reaching for liberty, equality, and justice. Bring these stories into your classroom today,  https://lnkd.in/e5trXUfa. Interested in supporting curricula like American Portraits? Visit,  https://lnkd.in/ePsJtSJy.
